programme.title: Rugrats in Paris: The Movie
programme.desc: The Rugrats are in Paris where Chuckies widowed father has been called on to mend an animated monster in a theme park, but its all a ploy by Coco LaBouche - the parks head, to get appointed head of a major company. As she and her henchman Jean-Claude plan to ensnare him, only the rest of the Rugrats can stop him falling for her charms.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Antiheroes
programme.desc: From Dirty Harry and The Godfather to the deeply imperfect gang from the Fast and the Furious franchise, this Cinema List celebrates our favourite anti-heroes.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Comic-book adventure about a stunt motorcyclist tricked into making a pact with Mephistopheles. The rider can only escape doing the demons bidding if he agrees to battle the dark lords son. To this end, he assumes the identity of the supernatural Ghost Rider, a terrifying night-time vigilante with a flaming skull.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: Though the Nazis fail to open the gates of Hell, one little devil gets through. Raised at a secret FBI lab, Hellboy is a cigar-chomping, crimson demon with a breezeblock for a right hand and a gift for fighting otherworldly beasts. Lively action fantasy based on the cult comic book.

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: An FBI agent must contend with a swarm of deadly serpents that have been released aboard an airliner to kill the witness he is escorting to trial.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: A car crash leaves a playboy maimed and charged with murder in this remake of the mind-bending film `Abre los Ojos.

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: Eastern European visitor Viktor arrives in New York only to find that his papers are no longer valid. Rules being rules, airport chief Dixon cant let Viktor into America, or let him leave. Viktor has to survive by his wits, and slowly becomes the darling of the airport, as his sweet nature charms all who work there - except Dixon.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Dumped and depressed, English rose Iris agrees to swap homes with similarly unlucky in love Californian Amanda for a much-needed break. Iris finds herself in a palatial Hollywood mansion while Amanda navigates the lanes of a picture-perfect English village. Soon enough, both lovelorn ladies bump into local lads perfect for a romantic pick-me-up.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: In Tokyo shooting a whisky commercial, middle-aged actor Bob Harris becomes attracted to Charlotte, the young wife of a celebrity photographer. Together they ride out their boredom of hotel life and their bewilderment of the city.

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: Based on the botched mission during Americas military involvement in Somalia in the early 1990s. An attempt by US Army Rangers parachuted into Mogadishu to capture a warlords two top lieutenants goes disastrously wrong when two helicopters are shot down.

programme.title: Angels and Demons
programme.desc: Having ruffled the feathers of the Catholic Church with his controversial investigations into Christian history, Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon is surprised to be approached by the Popes emissaries for help. Armed only with a balancing pole and intense determination, he walked out onto a single suspended wire and `danced for 45 minutes while balancing a quarter of a mile above the pavement below. The is the intimate story of Petit and his group of friends as they followed their dream.

programme.desc: The source of the Mekong River is high up in the Tibetan plateau, from there it flows into Yunnan Province, China, where our journey begins. Yunnan occupies less than four percent of Chinas land but it is home to over half of its birds and mammals.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A look at the lives of monkeys, chimps, orangutans and apes at the worlds biggest sanctuary, Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Lewa Conservancy is working to return elephants to territory from Mt Kenya to Samburu National Park. They have also created an elephant exclusion zone to try to restore a damaged ecosystem.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The beaches of California are some of the most beautiful in the world, but they are falling out of balance due to mankinds effects on nature. We ask what can be done to stop this.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: With approximately 130 active volcanoes, Indonesia is arguably the most active place on earth. Volcanologist Tom Pfeiffer leads an expedition to some of Indonesia most remote and rarely visited volcanos.

programme.desc: Hopes first orphaned mammal arrives earlier than ever and a patient from last year is back.

programme.desc: The 2016 European Grand Prix from Baku, Azerbaijan on the Baku City Circuit. This is the first time that this track has hosted an F1 event.

programme.title: Formula 1 Motor Racing
programme.desc: The 2017 Azerbaijan Grand Prix, held on the Baku City Circuit. This is the first time this race has been held on the F1 calendar, after Baku hosted last years European Grand Prix.

programme.title: Formula 1 Motor Racing
programme.desc: The 2018 Azerbaijan Grand Prix at the Baku City Circuit. Daniel Ricciardo of Red Bull won here last season after starting tenth on the grid.

programme.desc: Formula 1 returns to Baku for the 2019 Azerbaijan Grand Prix. Lewis Hamilton was victorious at this race last year.

Elsewhere, PC Paul Lowden and his German shepherd Oscar fall foul of his satnav while searching for a man on the run.

programme.desc: When Bull is sidelined with a back injury, Marissa and Chunk are forced to go to court without him to defend Marissas closest childhood friend, Kyla, a tech CEO accused of wrongfully terminating an employee.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: When a smuggler being detained by the CIA must be transferred quickly to a secure debriefing site, McCall works with Carter Griffin to ensure he arrives unharmed; Dante deals with the possibility of his father being released from prison.

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: The team has mixed feelings when a familiar face returns hoping to prove himself; an influencer gets his fans to come after Wesley; Tim supports Lucy as she prepares for the sergeants exam.

programme.title: FBI: Most Wanted
programme.desc: When an international beauty queen is killed on live television, the task force heads to Philadelphia to hunt down the killer; Hana senses that Ethan is hiding something.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Follow Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the countrys various quarantine, customs, immigration and finance laws.

programme.title: Naya Daur
programme.desc: A kind-hearted businessman who employs many people in a rural region of India decides to take a long pilgrimage and places his son in charge of his affairs. The boy is determined to modernise his fathers business but, in doing so, relieves many people of their livelihoods.

programme.title: Conversation with Rajkummar Rao
programme.desc: Rajkummar Rao, one of the most talented and versatile modern actors, talks about his being an outsider to the industry and the different shades of unique characters he plays and his success.

programme.title: Neend Hamari Khwab Tumhare
programme.desc: Nishad, daughter of a noble family, has three suitors. However, after making her decision, it comes to light that the groom only gained noble status after his father won the lottery.

programme.title: Virasat
programme.desc: Shakti Thakur returns home to the village in which he grew up with his girlfriend. After years of being abroad his life there is not what he expected it to be.

programme.title: Ijaazat
programme.desc: Mahendra is in love with Maya and would like to marry her, but Maya is a woman of the world, and does not believe in marriage.

programme.title: 1942: A Love Story
programme.desc: A man and womans love for each other is threatened as India struggles for independence.

programme.title: Satte Pe Satta
programme.desc: After the death of their parents, Ravi Anand, the eldest of seven, takes it upon himself to raise his brothers.

programme.title: Laila Majnu
programme.desc: Kaish Amari comes from a wealthy Islamic family. At the tender age of six he is sent to school and gets friendly with a young girl named Laila. Both of them become close friends, so much so that Kaish gets himself punished and beaten for her. They mature in age so does their love much to the chagrin of Lailas dad, who wants her to marry a wealthy Arabian, Bahksh, a noble Prince.

programme.title: Nazar Ke Samne
programme.desc: When Umesh is wrongly imprisoned for murder and given a death sentence, his lawyer has one week to track down the real killer.

programme.title: Patthar Ke Sanam
programme.desc: A prank backfires when two best friends realise that they both love the same man.

programme.title: Bulldog Drummonds Peril
programme.desc: The British sleuth marries Phyllis and nabs diamond counterfeiters for a Scotland Yard colonel.

programme.title: Captain Scarlett
programme.desc: An eponymous nobleman returns home from the Napoleonic Wars only to find the evil Duke de Corlaine has stolen his lands and is oppressing his people. With the help of Pierre DuCloux, he forms a gang of outlaws to fight injustice, finding time along the way to rescue the beautiful Princess Maria from the clutches of the wicked Count Villiers.

programme.title: Invasion
programme.desc: An extraterrestrial fugitive seeks refuge at a hospital.

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: Jed arranges a party for Granny when she feels lonely, and invites the Drysdales. Mr Drysdales boss, the board chairman of the bank, is determined to meet Jed Clampett, the banks "financial wizard".

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge
programme.desc: Aunt Sally is mistakenly sent with luggage of the new owner of Bloomsbury-Barton Hall.

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Batman locates Catwomans lair and manipulates her so that she leads him to Sandman. While Ohara and his men apprehend Catwoman, the dynamic duo pursues Sandman aboard their Batboat.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: Wicked Louis XIV of France has his twin brother Philippe imprisoned, with his identity hidden behind an iron mask. However, the ageing DArtagnan learns of the deception and, getting back together with his old musketeer comrades, concocts a plan to restore the rightful King to the throne.

programme.title: Look at Life
programme.desc: 1960. A look cinema and its evolution regarding comfort and the different types of films that draw audiences in.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: Stars Ron Randell, Ronan OCasey and Sam Kydd. Recently released convict Dickie Miller murders Arnold Brockley in an act of revenge.

programme.title: The Footage Detectives
programme.desc: Status Quos Francis Rossi joins Noel and Mike to chat about his love for vintage footage. Plus, were behind the scenes of 50s Pinewood with Belinda Lee and John Gregson!

programme.title: Look at Life
programme.desc: A look at the people who prepare salvaged steel to be re-used, also with a glimpse at the steel foundries which melt it all down again.

programme.title: St. Martins Lane
programme.desc: A street performer develops a poor girls talent, and a songwriter boosts her to music-hall fame.

programme.title: Memories of Making Sergeant Cork
programme.sub-title: Sergeant Cork Intro 3: Making the Show
programme.desc: Acclaimed actor William Gaunt talks about his time on the British detective series `Sergeant Cork. Here, he describes how the show was made.

programme.title: Sergeant Cork
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Two Drowned Men
programme.desc: Two thieves are found dead in the Thames and identified. Cork suspects they are stand-ins for the real criminals. He thinks the owners of the `Adam and Eve, a seedy riverside pub, know more than they are saying.

programme.title: The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club
programme.desc: At the Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club folk singer Bob Williamson performs Candid Camera, Five Foot Two, Railway Man and more.

programme.title: Cream: Farewell Concert
programme.desc: A portrait of the band includes interviews with members and footage of its 1968 concert at Londons Royal Albert Hall.

programme.desc: Southern Televisions version of Opportunity Knocks! This week starring: Koffee n Kreme. Young entertainers are given a chance to showcase their talent in their own production.

programme.desc: A selection of songs by Heritage Artists which are voted on in over 80 countries. Tune into songs you love from popular artists, live and on video with the odd interview.

programme.title: Force on Thunder Mountain
programme.desc: A hiking trip into the mountains brings father and son into contact with the Force.

programme.title: Time Warp
programme.desc: An astronaut accidentally discovers sabotage and a time warp while investigating a black hole.

programme.title: Time Warp
programme.desc: An astronaut accidentally discovers sabotage and a time warp while investigating a black hole.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Summer-y Sweet Pea Risotto and Slow Roasted Pork
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates summer with roasted fennel pork and gratin, oozy pea risotto, and rainbow slaw chicken wraps. He shares edible hanging basket tips. The feast finishes with stunning mackerel on sun-dried tomato couscous with colorful beets.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Buddys Strawberry Rice Pudding and Summer Tomato Chicken Bake
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a chicken sheet pan dinner with early tomatoes, potatoes and chorizo. Buddy helps pick strawberries for quick jam rice pudding. The summer feast ends with spicy shrimp skewers with homegrown chillies and a refreshing cucumber gazpacho.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Summer is coming to a close but theres still a bounty of fresh, seasonal produce to enjoy. Celebrate with Frankie as he makes some of his favorite cookout classics thatll take you from a weekend picnic to a backyard BBQ, with or without a grill.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie is all about BYOL - bring your own lunch. Its not only good for your wallet, its good for your health. Skip the vending machine and the cafeteria in favor of creative, cost effective and easy-to-transport midday meals.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Amp up your salad game with a little mixing and matching, from light and leafy greens to crisp and hearty toppings, and dressings for all occasions. Frankie shows us how versatile and fulfilling a homemade salad can truly be.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.sub-title: How Do You Like Them Apples
programme.desc: Apples arent just good for keeping the doctor away. Frankie demonstrates how to make the most of this beloved, everyday fruit, from sweet treats to savory meals. Theres a whole world of apples to dive into, especially while theyre in season.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Never underestimate the power of squash: theyre affordable, abundant and they come in all shapes, sizes, colors, and textures. Frankie spotlights squash from summer through winter highlighting their amazing superhero traits.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: No matter who youre rooting for, savor these ballpark favorites while beating those major league prices.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie harnesses the power of time to transform simple ingredients into flavorful goods thatll stick around for a long time. Learn the basics of preserving, pickling and curing to make dinner anything but a struggle. It just takes a little patience.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Its no secret that pasta is Frankies favorite; hes serving it up all night without even opening his fridge.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankies slicing, mashing and smashing his way through the spud species, a staple for any Struggle kitchen.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie teaches several methods for cooking eggs; the scramble, the omelet, and the Benedict; learn to make them just the way one likes them.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Ribs are a lifestyle, and Chef Dales living it up with smoky beef shorties in tangy red wine glaze, Miami-style pork ribs dripping in bacon-guava BBQ, spicy baked beans, and killer key lime caramel cones. Grab some napkins!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale is flipping burgers into art - gooey mac and cheese burgers, fancy French patties topped with melty bucheron cheese, crispy parm-truffle fries, and peanut butter fudge ice cream sandwiches. Get hungry.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Dales turning up the heat! Carolina Reaper wings hotter than your ex, sweet-chili NY strip steak, smoky grilled chipotle Texas toast, and ancho-gochujang pineapple skillet cake for dessert. Bring some water!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Dale fires up the tandoor grill, turning out juicy chicken thighs, smoky shrimp with Old Bay yogurt, crispy cauliflower, and a silky mango lassi dessert topped with crunchy candied pistachios. Tandoori done right!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Dale skewers ribeye, salmon, smoky eggplant dip, and grilled peaches. Food on sticks never tasted better!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Taco night, Dale-style! Puffy al pastor tacos stuffed with pineapple-chile pork, grilled chicken pepian with charred tomato sauce, crispy street corn ribs, and dulce de leche empanadas. Taco Tuesday who?

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Dale reinvents pizza night: grilled pizza bagels loaded with pepperoni, mozzarella-stuffed penne vodka pie, a massive grilled chop salad, and olive oil cake with burnt orange caramel. Pizza goals achieved.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Thanksgiving goes to the grill with Chef Dale-juicy spatchcock turkey, grilled sage-cornbread stuffing, smoked green bean casserole, and pumpkin donut bread pudding drenched in bourbon brown butter sauce.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Comforting and familiar but full of island flavor, right from the grill! Chef Dale roasts pork shoulder with chicharrones, steamy coconut rice and pigeon peas finished with frozen coconut rum drank with a charred banana.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: Wok Cooking On A Charcoal Grill
programme.desc: Anything is possible with a wok and a good ol charcoal grill, at least if youre Chef Dale, who throws together a heavenly spread of fiery eats, from drunken meats, stir fried veggies, and stir fried noodles.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: Grilled Loco Moco and Huli Huli Chicken
programme.desc: The options are plentiful when Chef Dale smothers grilled Loco Moco with a mushroom gravy, salty and sweet Huli Huli Chicken with charred pineapple, and healthy scoops of Tuna Water Chestnut poke or mac salad.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Summertime seasonal fruit pampers your tastebuds. Chef Dale grills blistered grapes with ham wrapped Trout, Peaches with smoked Pork Chops, Watermelon with halloumi, and Chargrilled Cherries with chocolate Mousse.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Wild Boar Feast: Chorizo with Mussels and Whole Roasted Leg
programme.desc: Wild boar takes center stage! Andrew makes chorizo with mussels, preserved lemon and white wine. Then, he slow-roasts a whole leg over fire, served Southern-style with pickled cherries, glazed onions and mustard sauce.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Southern Shrimp Skewers and Asian Crispy Rice
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern grills beloved shrimp in two distinct ways. He starts with jumbo shrimp and country ham skewers glazed with sweet-hot pepper jelly. Then, he creates Asian-inspired shrimp, served over crispy battle rice and a complex sambal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Elk Tenderloin Tostadas and Grilled Rack of Ribs
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern highlights lean elk, first crafting classic Mexican tostadas with grilled tenderloin, avocado, and homemade salsa macha. Then, he grills a whole rack of elk, serving it with creamy colcannon, tarragon emulsion, and rosemary charcoal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Grilled Clams Casino and Garlicky Clam Pizza
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern celebrates cherrystone clams with two show-stopping recipes. He prepares classic grilled clams casino with pancetta, then pushes boundaries with an innovative grilled pizza topped with clams, garlic, chiles, and cheese.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern explores Minnesotas forests for wild mushrooms. He creates a simple grilled mushroom salad, then hand-shapes cavatelli pasta tossed with golden chanterelles, butter, garlic, thyme, and colatura. He shares foraging and cleaning tips.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern showcases quail two ways: classic Southern fried quail with lemon-basil aioli, and as an elevated topping for a traditional open-fire paella, complete with crispy socarrat. He proves this small bird makes an extraordinary dinner.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Mediterranean Grilled Filets and Salt Crusted Halibut
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern elevates California halibut, first with grilled fillets on saffron labneh with romesco and roasted cabbage. Then, he demonstrates a classic salt-crusted whole halibut, served with whole roasted cauliflower and a rich cream sauce.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Venison Paillard and Hearty Hunters Stew
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern showcases venison two ways: a delicate grilled paillard with artichokes and parmesan, and a rich, slow-braised Polish hunters stew with kielbasa, mushrooms, and sauerkraut. Served with grilled leeks and coal-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Poultry Perfection: Moroccan Spiced Guinea Hen with Charred Vegetables
programme.desc: Andrew unlocks the rich flavor of guinea hen with a vibrant grilled salad featuring watercress and a mustard-hazelnut vinaigrette. Then, he slow-roasts a whole bird with Middle Eastern spices, served with harissa squash and eggplant-tahini puree.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Grilled Squid Salad and Crispy Squid on the Plancha
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern creates a vibrant salad where grilled squid is served with shaved fennel, cherry tomatoes, endive, and a lemon dressing. Then, Andrew shares his country-style squid on the plancha with fresh breadcrumbs, chilies, and a homemade aioli.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern shares his favorite way to prepare wild turkey breast, pan-fried over an open fire. Served with cheese sauce and jalapeno-bacon wild rice. Then, cooks a simple meal of seared salmon and a side of crispy potatoes and onions.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Zimmern cooks his version of Peking-style goose. Next, Chef Zimmern cooks a meal of striped bass.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: The Secret to Texas-Style Smoked Brisket
programme.desc: Pat and his buddy Leonard Botello use the flavors of the beloved native Post Oak to smoke a perfect Central Texas-style beef brisket.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: The Legend of Louis Muellers Dino Beef Ribs
programme.desc: Pat visits his close friend Wayne Mueller, third-generation pitmaster of Louis Muellers BBQ, to learn the ins and outs of his famous dino beef ribs.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to a picturesque cattle farm in Californias Santa Maria Valley, to hear firsthand from a young pitmaster who has uncovered the secrets of real Santa Maria barbecue.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Pit-Cooked Chicken with Alabama White Sauce
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to Decatur, Alabama to visit a storied institution of barbecue - Big Bob Gibsons. There, he learns the ins, the outs, and the history of a regional delicacy: pit-cooked chicken with Alabama white sauce.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Bluefin Tuna Collars with Chili Pickle Relish
programme.desc: Pat Martin visits chef Adam Perry Lang in Los Angeles, where the pair cook a prized catch castoff cut - Bluefin Tuna collars.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin teams up with fellow pitmasters to showcase the rugged and nuanced tradition of whole-hog cooking, West Tennessee-style.

programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern showcases venison two ways: a delicate grilled paillard with artichokes and parmesan, and a rich, slow-braised Polish hunters stew with kielbasa, mushrooms, and sauerkraut. Served with grilled leeks and coal-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie teaches several methods for cooking eggs; the scramble, the omelet, and the Benedict; learn to make them just the way one likes them.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie cooks his way back in time with his favorite vintage recipes. These oldie-but-goodie dishes are not only nostalgic and comforting, but theyll also fill you up without costing you a pretty penny.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Warm and hearty bowls of veggies, beans, pasta, and more, these soups will have you returning for seconds all year round. Frankies soup blueprints can turn everyday ingredients into extraordinary soups, with endless flavor opportunity.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: In a sandwich, every component plays a role. With a supporting cast of fixins, and Frankies cost-saving homemade twists, these sandwiches just might steal the show.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Cabbage has long been an underrated green on the field, and its about time Frankie gives it a starring role. This leafy head proves itself as the versatile ingredient we need it to be, affordable year around, delicious and filling.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Who knew mayo could be such a savvy secret agent? Its a controversial condiment that can unlock the buttery, crispy, decadent codes of our favorite dishes, without leaving a trace of mayo-ness. Best of all, its easy to make at home!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Reaching textural nirvana is never easy, but Frankie explores several ways to achieve the perfect crunch in his dishes, both savory and sweet. Add this elusive element to your recipes without adding cost to your budget.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: No veggie family packs the same nutritious punch as the cruciferous family, and with a shelf life this long, theyve become a fixture in Frankies meal rotation. These delicious and easy-to-make recipes will win everyone over in no time.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: These five-ingredient recipes are anything but boring; with a few pantry staples, these simple weeknight meals will be on the table in no time.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie throws a game day party for under $25. Game days arent for dinner parties but they are a day for some fan-favorite finger foods, especially those you can make in advance. Frankie makes three no-fuss appetizers.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie tracks down some fast, fresh and easy recipes, featuring tasty minty pea tortiglioni and gnocchi with roasted tomato sauce and rocket pesto.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie is taking spaghetti bolognese to the next level and re-creating a mind-blowing Jewish-Italian recipe. Theres also beef stew with pappardelle.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie gets a masterclass in Sicilian sweets and cooking up an epic tuna, prawn and pistachio spaghetti. Theres also some chocolaty cannoli.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie is high up in the Italian Alps cooking some great comfort food, including dumplings, mind-blowing macaroni cheese, and a classic red wine and sausage risotto.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie visits Basilicata in search of some old school Italian recipes and meets a family of shepherds and an 89-year-old macaroni master.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie fires up a steakhouse-style spread with Italian flair from golden beets and buttery mushrooms to a sizzling Bistecca alla Fiorentina steak with salmoriglio sauce, and a smooth cold brew affogato granita.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie fuels up for action making hot Oatmeal, and Energy Date Balls, before he cooks up the perfect post-ride feast of cheesy Juicy Lucy Burgers, Ramp-loaded pasta salad, and a maple ginger switchel to cool it all down.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie explores his Italian roots, pairing each pasta shape with its perfect sauce-from Cavatelli with Super Green Sauce to Pappardelle in pork ragout, ricotta Gnocchi with punchy anchovy pecorino, and cozy Squash Orzotto with bloomed poppy seeds.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie makes pizza magic with two incredible doughs, turning his kitchen into a pizza party with grilled sausage pizza, cheesy Grandma Pies, golden Panzerotti, and a sweet dessert pizza topped with ricotta, berries, and honey.

programme.desc: In `Breaking Amish, viewers got to know five young men and women who left their Amish or Mennonite traditions behind to experience for the first time a whole new world: New York City. In a spinoff series, the outliers - Abe, Rebecca, Kate, Sabrina and Jeremiah - take on more culture shock (a `brave new world), unexpected challenges and surprises along the way to a fresh start in Sarasota, Fla, home to a large community of Amish and former Amish. Despite the abundance of sunshine down South, the friends discover the grass isnt always greener on the other side.

programme.title: Edwardian Farm
programme.desc: Its June, and archaeologists Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn and historian Ruth Goodman head up to Dartmoor to discover the ways in which Edwardian farmers took advantage of this unique and spectacular landscape to add to their income. programme.title: Tales from the Green Valley
programme.desc: Its July and the teams first task is to get out into the meadow and start making hay while the sun shines. They try making their own washing liquid, lye, from wood ash to get on with the laundry, and get busy harvesting some of the 17th-century crops from the garden, such as red gooseberries and roses to lighten the mood.

When it returns to Shipton Abbott harbour several hours later, only the three fishermen remain. A note found on deck suggests the woman took her own life. As her estranged daughter comes to town to help make funeral arrangements, the simple case grows more complex. Meanwhile, its the day of the house visit, but its no plain sailing for Humphrey and Martha.

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: When a priest from a Catholic boarding school suddenly disappears, Humphrey and Esther find that his case has uncanny similarities to a local myth - The Devil on the Rocks. Why was he last seen marching on a nearby beach in the middle of a dense fog, and where is he now? With the schools headmistress reluctant to aid the investigation, a large sum of money missing from the school safe, and the priest nowhere to be found, the team have their work cut out trying to pin down the truth.

programme.desc: Indulgent entertaining doesnt have to be costly to be spectacular. programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels from Texas and down the length of Mexico. programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Series following a group of trawler fishermen in Peterhead, Scotland. Prawn boat Amity is in the grip of a winter storm, 100 miles from shore, with its nets caught on the seabed. Skipper Jimmy Buchan and his crew battle to save the boat and themselves. Elsewhere, a rival prawn trawler is filling its nets. Skippered by the young and ambitious James West, Fruitful Bough is one of the most successful boats in Peterhead.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Jimmy Buchan, skipper of the prawn trawler Amity, has just hours to decide whether to run through a storm to Peterhead or try and ride it out. Fruitful Bough, another prawn boat, is also wondering what to do - face the mountainous seas and gale force winds or lose vital fishing time by taking shelter in the Shetland Islands? Away from the storm, the whitefish boat Ocean Venture isnt catching any valuable haddock.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Ocean Venture has headed north and is fishing at `The Edge, only 150 miles south of the Arctic Circle. Having failed to catch enough fish, skipper John Buchan is taking a huge risk in the deep and treacherous waters of the North Atlantic in a bid to find the perfect catch. With the previous nights storm over, Amity gets back to the business of trying to catch prawns.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Offshore fishing, the most dangerous job in Britain, has a problem when it comes to getting new recruits, but 17-year-old Ryan wants to take up the challenge. He sets out on his first trip on one of the most successful pair of trawlers in Britain as they head into the rough Norwegian waters looking for cod and haddock. If he doesnt impress skipper Kevin West, hell be looking for a new job when they come back.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard travels to Cyprus where he pits the new Porsche Cayenne Turbo S against the British Armys freefall parachute display team, the Red Devils. The BMW Z4M flexes its muscles when the Stig power tests it on the track, and the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car is Ewan McGregor.

programme.title: Rick Steins Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: Rick Stein takes the viewer on an epic culinary journey by sea, down rivers and overland to explore the Far Easts diverse food cultures. He begins his odyssey in Cambodia, where he discovers the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs cooked with green peppercorns from Kampot, once the king of pepper. He learns how to cook the famous Fish Amok, made with lemongrass and coconut and he samples Lok Lak.

programme.desc: Newly promoted Sergeant Jo Masters and PC Leon Taylor are called to an aggravated burglary which has left the homeowner, John Baker, dead. As DS Max Carter and DC Grace Dasari investigate, they discover that Bakers wife Tanisha has been on a missing persons list for 20 years, and further questioning establishes that she ran away from home to marry John because her parents disapproved of the relationship.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When a letter bomb is delivered to the offices of a high profile company, the manager believes it to be a hoax, but Grace is concerned that it is the beginning of something sinister. The officers suspect that a regular courier is behind it - the man had been thrown out of the building a few days previously for harassing a PA.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sgt Stone and PC Leon Taylor find themselves involved in an armed siege after Alan Wilcock reports that his mentally unbalanced ex-wife Carly has locked herself in his house with their young son. When she discharges a firearm, CO19 are called in to diffuse the situation, and Sgt Jo Masters quickly establishes a rapport with the aggrieved woman through an internet link, but she becomes increasingly hysterical as time goes by.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sgt Callum Stone is on his way home from a night out when he sees couple Clarinda Blake and Tim Hardacre arguing in an alley. When Tim starts to hit Clarinda, Callum goes to her defence but gets a severe beating in return. Clarinda is traced and questioned but insists she was the victim of a random mugging. It emerges that Clarindas teenage son Andy had been dealing weed for Tim and when Clarinda found out, she confronted him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sgt Callum Stone and Sgt Jo Masters respond to a call to deal with a fracas outside a nightclub. Attending to the injured, Stone uses more force than necessary to stop a passer-by interfering and the incident is captured on a mobile phone and posted online. When the passer-by brings charges against Stone, new Sun Hill Commander Lisa Kennedy and Supt Jack Meadows worry about the media fallout and start an inquiry.

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Grumpy but promiscuous judge Jeremy Harding is sent compromising photographs of himself with a young woman. He blames Beatrice, but she denies it.

programme.desc: Lyle goes home to Stockport with his mother to prevent the council from selling off local allotments for a golf course.

programme.desc: Peter is hired to stop Lord Robert, a mad ex-junkie who is selling off the family estate when not cavorting nude in fountains or shooting at people.

programme.desc: Greg is suspended as police surgeon, while a martial arts instructor covered with bruises is reluctant to reveal how the injuries were sustained.

programme.desc: When PC Nate Roberts and PC Benjamin Gayle are caught up in a shooting, Inspector Dale Smith and Sergeant Jo Masters are called to begin an investigation. programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.sub-title: Miami Twice: Oh, to Be in England
programme.desc: With Del handling the accommodation and transport for their weeks holiday in America, its not surprising that he and Rodney end up in a dodgy camper-van. Things get even worse when the van disappears while they are in a nightclub.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Things are moving on for the Trotter family as Del is now a dad, and Rodney is back with Cassandra. However, Del is down in the yuletide dumps with money problems, and Rodders worries his `bruv has lost his drive.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Things have gone so well for the Trotters that Del and Rodney decide to treat Uncle Albert to a surprise birthday party. And Rodney has a night on the town with a date, but things dont quite go according to plan.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Del, Rodney and Uncle Albert take their mates from the Nags Head on a disastrous day trip to Margate. A worried Cassandra is none too happy at Rodney joining the party having just celebrated their first anniversary.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Rodney gets an unexpected windfall and decides to take Cassandra on the holiday of a lifetime in Miami, unaware that the non-refundable tickets are for the day of her banks seminar in Eastbourne. In a show of brotherly love, Del naturally offers to accompany Rodders, and so they bid farewell to Peckham and embark on a holiday they are likely never to forget.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The team joins the search for a missing aeroplane pilot and passenger. A man digging for antique bottles in a South Yorkshire tip is buried alive, leading to a desperate fight to save him.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A student climber plunges from a cliff face in Wharfedale and the team fears he has broken his neck. The medics are also called to treat the victim of a stabbing at a meat plant.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The medics spring into action when a cyclist plunges down a cliff in a freak accident. A homeowners booby trap, designed to deter burglars, sparks a major rescue operation.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A landslip at a construction site traps a worker under tons of earth. Reports of a riot at a school come in and medic Alex must lead the operation to treat the injured.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A car crash victim has to be put into an induced coma at the roadside. Andy is called in to stand by as bomb disposal experts deal with a mortar dating back to the Boer War.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The response teams rush to save the life of a 21-year-old man who has been shot twice in the chest at a Doncaster pub. Another man has a seizure in the cab of his tipper truck.

programme.title: 999: Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A doctor on his way home from work is left fighting for his life after a head-on collision with a truck. Leeds paramedic Chris is called to a motorcyclist who has been hit by a taxi.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team break with tradition and actually follow Dave Mathewsons advice on what to restore.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team restore a 1988 Golf GTI Convertible - an iconic hot hatch - along with a wooden launch boat and catch-up on a Mk1 Austin Mini.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A super-rare Renault Clio Williams 2 in F1 blue with contrasting gold alloys has turned Dave Mathewson an interesting shade of green.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team snap up a slightly saggy Seventies Saab 96, but despite a stunning restoration, could it result in a record financial loss when it goes to auction?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team purchase a 1950s Austin Westminster rally car in the hope that seasoned competitor Dave Mathewson can win a race.

programme.desc: The team are on the hunt to restore one of the greatest names in motoring history - the Bugatti. But with a strict budget they settle for a replica.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Two newlyweds bought their home from her grandparents to keep it in the family. While the home is spacious, the chopped-up layout makes entertaining a challenge. Drew and Jonathan do a complete overhaul to update the home.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick is one of Englands top animal doctors and the subject of 2010 documentary programme `The Bionic Vet, which showcased some of the work done at his Surrey clinic. On `The Supervet Fitzpatrick and his staff treat some of the countrys hardest-to-cure pets with cutting-edge treatments and surgery. The programme tells the emotional stories of the pets, their owners and the passionate team that push the boundaries of veterinary medicine to save the animals from life-threatening conditions.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows his 1930s Bradshaws guide to the unspoilt East Sussex Cinque Port of Rye. On the windswept harbour beach, he hears how, in 1928, a generation of lifeboatmen lost their lives in a tragic rescue attempt at sea.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael heads to the splendid Walmer Castle, home during the 1920s to Lord Beauchamp. Michaels guide, the founder of the LGBTQ working group for English Heritage, tells Michael of the lavish homosexual parties Lord Beauchamp held at the castle.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Herne Bay to Leeds Castle, Kent
programme.desc: Michael reaches the Kent seaside resort of Herne Bay, where he learns about a pioneering aviatrix who began her working life as a typist in Hull but whose epic achievements made her an international celebrity.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael continues his journeys in greater London. Beginning on its southeastern fringe in the leafy and historic village of Chislehurst, Michael finds surprising imperial connections and a dark labyrinth beneath.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team take on a modern day fast Ford to see if a quick flip could make a few quid and revisit a 3 year MG restoration project thats still not finished.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 90s Alfa with electrical issues lives up to its stereotype and the team revisit a road roller, four years on. They also tackle a French motoring icon, the Citroen 2CV6 Dolly.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Charlie head south for an immaculate Lotus Super 7. Derek and Jack are in Sheffield collecting a 1929 Riley Monaco and a 1924 Alvis 12/50 tourer.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will Trickett and Gus Gregory hunt for neglected cars they can fix and flip for a profit. Any losses incurred by their flipping come out of their own pockets.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Studying the seasonal changes in the richest waters on Earth, where the annual cycle of the Sun drives an explosion of life, reveals an extraordinary variety of marine animals including seals, dolphins, jellyfish and the bizarre walking handfish.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: The fragile ecosystems that have grown around the worlds coral reefs. The reefs take hundreds of years to develop and are adorned with spectacularly colourful life. However, this is not always an idyllic tropical paradise - one big storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: How do the tides affect marine life? Find out with the giant stingrays that glide on currents, the snails that surf the waves in pursuit of a meal, and the dolphins that play a deadly game of catch.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explains how animals from in and around the sea manage to make use of the constantly changing areas where land meets water. Spectacular mass turtle egg-layings, which take place in the same location over just a few days each year, and killer whales hunting seal pups are among the unforgettable visual highlights.

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve voyages across the Coral Triangle, a huge wilderness of tropical seas and islands. Surrounded by the Philippines, Malaysia and Indonesia, the Coral Triangle is one of the most beautiful corners of the oceans.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Crossing the Solent with a ticket to Ryde, Michael boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton. His destination is Osborne House, where the future King Edward VII spent much of his childhood.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo promises to do his best on the island where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of modern scouts he learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys and girls today.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a railway adventure from the coalfields of South Wales around the Bristol Channel to the southernmost tip of Cornwall. His first stop is Whitland in Carmarthenshire, where in the early 20th century, thrill-seekers gathered on Pendine Sands to indulge their need for speed. Michael joins latter day petrol heads to burn rubber on the beach in an iconic 3 wheeler.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael strikes gold at the Royal Mint in Llantrisant where after much frisking, he gains access to the inner vaults. At Cardiff Arms Park, Michael revisits the scene of a triumphant Welsh victory over the fearsome All Blacks and hears from Welsh international, Gerald Davies, how the Welsh national anthem kicked the intimidating Haka into touch.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
